titleStmt.title: Groans from New-Gate or An elegy on the suspention of the famous thief Thomas Sadler, fifteen times student in that renowned colledge, who to the great regret of all his assotiates, was translated to Tyburn, March, 16th. 1677.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Illustrious muse! on thee we call ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
